thread.title: Dodgers' Utley suspended 2 playoff games for 'illegal' slide
thread.title_full: Dodgers' Utley suspended 2 playoff games for 'illegal' slide

title: Dodgers' Utley suspended 2 playoff games for 'illegal' slide
text:
Dodgers 2B Chase Utley suspended 2 playoff games vs Mets for 'illegal' slide on Tejada in NLDS By MIKE FITZPATRICK AP Baseball Writer   10:30   10:30   
Photos: 
New York Mets shortstop Ruben Tejada, goes over the top of Los Angeles Dodgers' Chase Utley who broke up a double play during the seventh inning in Game 2 of baseball's National League Division Series, Saturday, Oct. 10, 2015 in Los Angeles. (AP Photo/Gregory Bull) 
New York Mets shortstop Ruben Tejada falls after a slide by Los Angeles Dodgers' Chase Utley during the seventh inning of an NL Division Series baseball game Saturday, Oct. 10, 2015, in Los Angeles. (John McCoy/Los Angeles Daily News via AP) 
NEW YORK â€” Los Angeles Dodgers second baseman Chase Utley was suspended two playoff games by Major League Baseball on Sunday night for his late takeout slide that broke New York Mets shortstop Ruben Tejada's right leg. 
Utley's agent called the penalty "outrageous and completely unacceptable" and said there would be an appeal. 
The Mets and Dodgers are tied at 1-all in the NL Division Series. Game 3 is scheduled for Monday night at Citi Field. 
An appeal would allow Utley to play until the hearing process is complete. MLB would likely try to resolve the matter Monday, before the series resumes. 
In handing down the penalty, MLB executive Joe Torre called it an illegal slide. Umpires ruled it a legal play Saturday night. 
Torre said after a complete review, he concluded Utley's slide merited punishment.
